title: Counterplay to a champion should not be "destroy them before X minutes"
body:
this has to be the most retarded bullshit i ever heard
{{champion:29}} has no counterplay period, you have xayah gimicked around feathers, cait around traps and headshot that puts a lot of power budget around bushes, draven around axes, jhin around 4th shot that leaves him weak for 2.6 seconds
twitch is not limited in any way, and his ability to deal an assassin lvl of damage per second in AOE from stealth from 830 range is absolutly cancerous and overpowered as he gets to have 53.5% win rate right now

"but muh, his early game he's weak until he has 2 items"

and? want to know which game tried to balance hard carries like that? indeed dota 2

counterplay to faceless void stunning your entire team for 5 seconds and killing them all? don't get to late game lul, which wasn't a good way to balance the champion and he got reworked 

this late game thing doesn't work, those champions will always either be garbage because games duration is low, or absolutly overpowered as they have no counterplay in late game
 
now i don't know if twitch needs a rework, but right now his no counterplay gameplay should not be allowed

Years of mana changes and item changes now mean that he can go top and start {{item:2033}} and rarely if ever, have to worry about mana.  Add in how cheap lethality is to get, and you get a champ that hasnt been looked at in ages slowly creep his way to the fore because of incremental changes.

Eventually he will get a rework, but I'd rather see Q changed to a longer ranged skillshot, to break up that part of his laning phase and increase his skillcap

If I recall correctly, your previous suggestion for the stealth range nerf sounded like a good change. Forgetting the details on that suggestion though, would you mind reiterating it?

stealth radius increased to 575 because his AA range is 550
Eve ult range was decreased to 600 to be inferior to her stealth radius (700)

either you increase his stealth radius to 575, or you decreased his AA range

and of course, do not allow him to ult while being stealthed, so he will have to wait for the invisibility to end to ult and thus either he breaks his invisibility by an AA or he waits the end to ult
in both cases this leaves you time to react to him

But that is what his kit revolves around. If you take away the element of surprise he not only becomes utterly unfun to play as, but he will also become utterly useless as a champion. I believe its a change Riot did few seasons ago pretty counsciously, and Im glad they did.

useless?

how is a champion dealing over 1500 damage in 1 sec in AOE useless?
no, he will be able to do his job(aoe damage from range) but with counterplay

i don't call this useless
and even if he ended up useless he would be healthier and could get compensation buffs

Take away his element of surprise? Let me put it into perspective for you, Evelynn, Talon, Teemo, Kha'zix, Rengar. All of these champions have a stealth mechanic, you know what's different for them? They can't activate abilities while stealthed or it will reveal them. Thing is, their melee, they have to get in range, it makes sense for them to become invisible to do so especially since they sacrifice safety and mobility for it, Talon for example has no way to get out of a fight once he's in unless he hops over a wall, if he hopped over one wall to get in, he also can't use the same one to get out, you know what that is? Counter play. 

A ranged champion with the kind of range that Twitch has, doesn't have to sacrifice anything for it, he can stay well out of a fight easily and unlike other stealth champions, you can't see him until after he attacks. With everyone else you can see them at least a split second before they do, rengar will actually reveal himself when he click on you with his ultimate, when he leaps out that gives you 1 second to react to him. With twitch, if you see him, he's already dealt damage.

They should reduce the piercing damage. Doing less damage as it reaches back lines this allows counter play in form of peels. Also Caitly only needs traps in lane after lane face she can mostly just run and kill people with AA and rope to safety if needed. Her AA are long and punishing she by no means is limited or countered by her traps. Her traps punish you for stepping on them and it's like a bonus to her.

wait what?

caitlyn has no steroids, her only steroid is her passive that takes a long time to charge unless in a bush and now it takes really a lot of time to be charged since runnan doesn't affect it anymore

so cait is basically walking around without a steroid unless in a bush, this makes her automatically losing a teamfight as she will deal less damage than an other hypercarry that has a reliable steroid
UNLESS someone walks in a trap to give her headshot+bonus 180+40% AD or something like that

> caitlyn has no steroids, her only steroid

her virtually unmatched range on her AA's is her steroid man. In fact, I see her banned more than any other champ in the game. She's banned so often that people don't see her enough to understand to bitch about her when it comes to crazy powerful champs. So yea, tell me again how she has nothing going for her. Fyi, her passive has three ways to activate. By AA stacking, her traps, and her net which is where it's crazy op. In fact, a smart cait can fire three headshots in a row if she's crafty about it. I don't mind her personally, but for you to act like she's not as big of an issue as some of the other ADCs. Well, quite frankly, that's ridiculous.

but when riot has been reworking so many champs to have windows of power and very obvious counterplay, ESPECIALLY the ones who are strong early-mid game they should do the same for late game champions too

I - wha?

Faceless Void can still stun your entire team for 5 seconds and destroy them. It's just super unreliable - his rework was focused on giving him _more tools that he could use early on_ so that you didn't have to run him as a carry to justify abusing Chronosphere. Because that was always really unreliable. But if a team is willing to take that risk, they can still have Void hard-farm to become a carry that completely disables the enemy team for 5 seconds as he and everyone with range on his team pounds into them.

Also, this may surprise you, but DOTA has 113 heroes, with quite a few of them being carries and all of them having varying power curves. And in fact, most of them have crummy early games in exchange for being absolute monsters later on, with the main counterplay late being getting off really good ganks or just having a harder scaling carry. Seriously, have you never heard of Medusa, or Spectre, or Naga Siren? Do you actually have any idea what you're talking about?

Uhm, no. First I want to mention that Sven was just picked by VP an hour ago in their game against IG, and they just picked him again for game 3. Also, the buff was more of a mini-rework to his ult, sacrificing a bit of damage for more tankiness, as well as made ancient stacking a lot more viable. Sven is in a fine spot right now.

And to your point where most carries have a weakness that needs to be countered with such as mana burn, sven does have some, and it mostly revolves around playing around his cooldowns. Sven is weak when BKB and God's Strength is off cooldown, and if you bait him to activate it, you can play around it, and punish him afterwards.

isn't god's strength duration like 26 sec?
how exactly do you bait it? since he also gives his entire team a sivir ult?

First off, you can bait it, but I was mostly focusing on the BKB. If you get him to have his BKB at a 5 second duration, it is extremely possible to then lock him down with Hexes, Stuns, etc. Not to mention, certain team comps and heroes can offer large team escapes such as Underlord and Centaur, meaning that they can effectively get the team out of a fight when Sven ults, and after the 25 secs, it would be considerably safer to re-engage. However, it still is more effective to play around the BKB, and once the 5 second duration expires, you hit him with CC and other stuns and kill him. Once Sven is locked down, the rest of his team will most likely not have that much DPS, and they will more or less not be too much of a threat.

Its true sadly, same goes for Kog'Maw. 

If you take too long to end the game and the enemy team has a decent frontline you're screwed.

Difference is that twitch inherently creates map pressure in the game. If he's not in vision he might be in your lane. You're not gonna get flanked by a kog maw in mid lane at 7 minutes into the game.

Kog'Maw does a buttload of damage, but he doesn't have the agency to accelerate the pace of the game. A fed kog'maw can just be avoided, whereas a fed twitch will force fights and picks and make it unsafe to farm.
I've ganked mid lane as mf before, though. Don't hate on the power of running up and laying down aoe slows behind the other mid laner.

I can't wait until Twitch loses like 5 E damage and suddenly there's a new OP lmao

Like his balance is entirely based on itemization, he's a very basic adc.  When AS is too strong Twitch is too strong and the versa.  He relies on getting off several procs and is single target.  He's prob broke in solo queue just because he has an Eve effect and Riot has been nerfing the fuck out of wards every season, but in competitive he's situational at best.  Kog tends to be better Twitch when you're in organized 5s since he has midgame powerspike and the range boost more consistently.

But you know when I read that title I don't think of Twitch, I think about how overnerfed Trist and Kalista are and how Yasuo is constantly rebalanced.  They don't know how to do late game right, you say there's no counterplay for Twitch and if you're weaker than him late its a bit of a stat check but he's an immobile sieger.  Often this design is the worst when it's applied to someone who's actually mobile since you won't even have "CC them" as an option since most ccs are skillshots and mobility makes skillshots weaker.

Honestly I'd love if Twitch's powercurve looked like Lucian or Draven's, I can't pick this guy into hard matchups or games with strong assassins and I've mained him a couple years now.  His power budget is mostly in attack speed and his R which are scaling abilities.  Maybe if the passive was moved to E and he was given something as compensation I think a small rework could be justified for that purpose, but Riot is ok with making absurd early and shit late and the vice versa as champion designs.  

I don't like hard counters or removing agency, but just because Twitch is above average one patch he gets called broken when there's has been and will be more problematic designs.  He's entirely based on items right now which is ok to a point, but it means he has to be strong late and can't rely on base damage.

So how would you justify a late game scaling champion in an early/midgame meta?  Are you saying that Twitch should be weak in late game?  What would be the purpose of him then?  How would you change him?  Why would those changes fix the problem and why will those change not dumpster twitch?  Twitch is a very short range ADC that has one of the hardest times getting out of laning phase.  He has no escape save his stealth (which is easily countered by being close to him).  Twtich can only make one strong play and that revolves around the timing of his ultimate.  You want counterplay?  Keep track of his ultimate and when a teamfight starts be prepared to disengage at first then try to reengage after his ult is down.  I know that is harder to do then it sounds but it is doable.  It becomes much harder when a team is designed around a protect the twitch composition as Lulu, Orianna, and Karma all give MS boosts with their shields.  This is why team coordination is so important as you can do crazy combinations like that to win games.
